description: Employ the very latest technologies and build progressive web apps in a geographical scaled, cloud only environment. In addition, most importantly: work with a fun and talented group of colleagues.What you'll do:As a Front End Web Engineer, you will develop new progressive web apps to help bring our DIY website platform (www.sitebuilder.com) to the next levelYou will work on a React front-end and build ES2018 libraries using webpack, and build highly scalable systems that support millions of usersYou will work in an Agile team with full-stack, front-end, back-end engineers, designers, product owner, and testersWho you are:4+ years with the modern ES6+ UI development frameworks React and experience with SPAs (Single Page Applications)2+ years with the reactjs stack and state management librariesUnderstanding Task-based Asynchronous Programming ES2018Comfortable with build tools like Babel and WebpackAbility to convert a Sketch designs into a working PWAExperience building for all devices, including knowledge and understanding of responsive/adaptive design patternsFamiliar with common design tools (e.g. Sketch, Invisionapp, Framer X)Experience working with Storybook.JS as a UI development environmentWhy you'll love us:We know you're more than what you do from 9-5. Whether you can't learn enough about Ayurveda, or prefer to spend free time walking shelter dogs at your local animal rescue, we support however you fuel your passion when you're not fueling our brands. Our employees use our products for free (or at deep discount!) to help them refine their passion projects.We keep you well fed and hydrated. Daily breakfasts, healthy snacks, flavored seltzer dispensers, and lunch every Friday. And don't miss our bar with four rotating taps and Willy Wonka style candy counter.We volunteer. A lot. Through partnerships with local charities like Rosie's place, Junior Achievement, and Lazarus House, our teams are routinely out in our community giving back and doing good.Love fitness? So do we! Enjoy our free fitness center, just a short stroll away, and outdoor yoga all summer long.Plentiful parking. Park further away to get your steps, or as close as you can to the entrance - it doesn't matter to us, because there's plenty of free onsite parking and electric car charging stations.Stretch your legs. We have stand up desks, and if you're really motivated, you can do a few miles on the treadmill desks. We have communal seating to work and chat if you need a fresh view. Go ahead, get moving!We've got you covered. From 401k, generous PTO, tuition reimbursement, casual dress code and excellent medical, dental, and vision - we're there for you!#INDENG

.NET Developer AINS develops a family of COTS products for advanced dynamic case management. Our eCase case management framework is a robust platform for implementing multiple coexisting adaptive case management (ACM) solutions with a single commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) solution. eCase utilizes proven core functionalities to deliver backbone case management and business process management elements such as workflow, document and case materials management, search, tracking/reporting and auditing.Location: Lorton, VA - Active or Interim Secret Clearance requiredSoftware Developer technical skills: Specific knowledge and hands on experience should include: Web Application Development using ASP.NET/C# . Knowledge and hands on experience with RDBMS database development using SQL/ORACLE queries and stored procedures; User interface design using HTML, XML, MVC, ASPX, JavaScript and JQuery. Candidates should have good analytical skills and technical skills so that they can independently apply to develop web applications. Additional skills needed include: the ability to diagnose application issues in source code, network communication, web-service processing, relational database design, and web-service interactions. AINS utilizes Agile software methodology, therefore candidates must have knowledge with Scrum Product Logs, Sprint Planning, Source Control, Work items, Code reviews following strict coding standards, coding environment setup for unit/system automated testing, automated build processes.Skills & Experience Requirements3-5 years of Web Application development experience· 3-5 years of experience with C# development· 3-5 years of experience with VS and TFS· 3-5 years of experience with Microsoft .NET tools and technologies including ASP.NET (MVC & Web API) and WCF Web Services· Experience in developing 508 and WACG 2.0 compliant web pages· AJAX/JavaScript/JQuery· Web API/Web Services/LINQ/REST/IIS Management· Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle or MySQL and Stored Procedures· Agile software development methodologyRequired license or certification: US Citizen with an active Secret Security ClearanceAbout AINS, Inc.Digital transformation is reinventing businesses of every size and industry. Demand for rapid app development has never been higher.At AINS, we are shaping the future of work with big ideas that challenge conventional thinking and a new approach to solving complex business challenges. Through our low code, adaptive case management software, we enable organizations to bring new solutions to market quickly, digitize customer engagement and automate unique business processes across diverse lines of business.If you are a talented, entrepreneurial candidate with an interest in driving growth, then we want to talk with you.AINS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:Web Application Development: 3 years (Preferred).NET: 3 years (Preferred)SQL: 3 years (Preferred)ASP.NET/C#: 3 years (Preferred)Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Location:Lorton, VA (Preferred)License:Active Secret Clearance (Preferred)

description: Date Posted:2019-08-16-07:00Country:United States of AmericaLocation:HIA32: Cedar Rapids, IA 400 Collins Rd NE , Cedar Rapids, IA, 52498-0505 USAWe are currently searching for aSenior Software Engineer– to join our Virtual Avionics Engineering team in Cedar Rapids, IA (1000). reporting to management and peers, comfortable mentoring and leading, and good at enlisting and working with teammates and customers.Job ResponsibilitiesWork with management, engineering and customers to identify and capture training requirements and then flow out to the team.Collaborate with avionics target teams to identify their program schedules, dependencies and risks.Bid, plan, schedule, management in accordance with tailored Collins Technical Consistent Process.Assist teammates and customers in troubleshooting, diagnosing, and resolving avionics systems questions and training software issues on COTS PCs running in Collins simulation environments.Releases, installs, operates and tracks training device and software development while supporting and maintaining documents, methods, and procedures necessary to perform these activities.Assist in building and improving the engineering development process and product quality by identifying deficiencies, creating corrective actions, and improving engineering practices.Plans, prepares and supports customer delivery, installation, and acceptance and integration testing.Conducts systems analysis and documents requirements, risks, and test plans and procedures.Effectively interacts and networks with teammates, management and customers across project, department, enterprise and company boundaries.Will represent the organization as a primary contact and liaison for technical customer support.May require domestic and international travel to support requirements, pursuits, demonstrations and product integration.Basic QualificationsBachelor degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Math (STEM) disciplines with at least 5 years of experience.Master degree in a Science, Technology, Engineering applications into simulation environments.United Technologies Corporation is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. At Signify you’ll work with top technology partners, learn new skills and grow your career. Your work will make a huge - and high-tech - impact. If you are looking for a challenge, you will find it at Signify. Do you want to join the undisputed leader in the lighting industry? We have over 16,000 patents and invest around 5% of our sales in R&D. We are looking for technical professionals who take our innovations and help us invent the future of lighting.We’re looking for a Principal Back-end Java Developer to develop innovative distributed cloud-based services that developers and customers love to use! You will be a committed member of the team who focuses on what’s important, sees technical ambiguity as an opportunity rather than a challenge and has the communication skills and knowledge that will make you an indispensable member of any software engineering organization.This role is part of IoT Infrastructure team, based in Burlington, MA. Its responsibilities are to provide the infrastructure and expertise to collect and process really Big Data, originating from the ubiquitous lighting infrastructure, our customers, and our business processes, in order to support differentiated systems and data-enabled servicesTogether we can…Create, manage and operate a diverse set of Dev-Ops-related tools, processes, paradigms and technologies that enable the creation and ongoing operation of the Signify IoT Platform.Follow the DevOps model; therefore, deploying features to AWS cloud.Focus on the creation of horizontal tools, technologies and best-practices that enable and support all the IoT Platform engineering teams to build, debug, test, release, manage and secure the IoT Platform’s modern, microservices-based cloud infrastructure.Collaborate in defining the methodologies and ways-of-working that will enable our fast-paced engineering teams to flourish as we collectively build-out the IoT Platform. You will help promote and implement best practices and supporting tools/technologies for source control management, CI and CD architectures, performance, SLAs, security, audit and monitoring that will be used by every engineer within the IoT Platform organization.Define common frameworks and software libraries, in various programming languages, that support the creation of efficient, scalable and highly available microservice-based architectures.Support with the management of the running IoT Platform system architecture. You will troubleshoot issues and identify areas for continuous improvement with a particular emphasis on quality, performance and security.Work closely with architects and technical product managers and other members of your team to translate overall system architecture and product requirements into well-designed, implemented and tested software solutions.Work in an Agile environment to deliver high-quality software in an incremental manner.Help promote the adoption of best-in-class software engineering practices, frameworks, and tools. You are providing guidance and feedback to other software developers.You are…B.Sc. in Computer Science or related Engineering is required, a Master’s degree is desirable8+ years of proven, hands-on track-record as a software engineer, focused on cloud-based systemsMastery of a variety of programming languages – at least Java, Python, but knowledge of Golang or JavaScript (NodeJS) are desirable. You must have strong Java Development skills, preferably with Ver. 1.8Proven track record developing cloud-based services (SaaS) and platforms (PaaS)Proven hands-on in-depth experience of AWS is required, both in terms of traditional technologies (e.g. EC2, S3, DynamoDB, RDS, …) as well as more recent cutting-edge paradigms (e.g. Lambda, API Gateway, Fargate, …).Proven experience of developing microservices and complex microservice-based platform architecturesExcellent understanding of distributed systems, designing for scalability, performance and availabilityExperience of establishing non-functional best-practices and deploying supporting technologies for improving platform security (including audit) and reliability (latency, availability, scalability)Knowledge of distributed network architectures and network security is requiredGood knowledge of data persistence technologies including relational databases and no-SQL solutionsExcellent interpersonal and technical communication with peers, and non-peers alike, with a can-do attitude3+ years in teams applying modern agile software development practicesWe are…Signify, the new company name of Philips Lighting, is the global leader in lighting building on 125+ years of innovations.Our purpose is to unlock the extraordinary potential of light for brighter lives and a better world.We are proud to be ahead of the game in the Internet of Things and on track to be carbon neutral by 2020. We learn through disruptive challenges and our performance is powered through our diverse teams. Our Philips products interact connected lighting systems, and data-enabled services transform people’s lives in homes, buildings, and public spaces.We define the meaning of light…join us to #findyourmeaning @ Signify! #LI-FM1

Description:Businesses need internal software applications to keep things running smoothly and EBS Contracts Applications are the cornerstone of Lockheed Martin business execution. As part of the Contracts Applications Portfolio, Electronic Intra-Lockheed Martin Work Transfer Authorization application (eIWTA) facilitates B2B transactions between Lockheed Martin’s business units.As part of the eIWTA team you will collaborate with our change control board to prioritize, design, develop, test and deploy enhancements and fixes for this enterprise application. You will join our Agile development team, which values team interaction, customer collaboration and demonstration of our development efforts to our customers as part of our sprint activities. You will develop solutions for a three-tier application using Java Server Pages, EJBs, Oracle and WebLogic application server and manage your work using Jira. Finally, you will gain an invaluable understanding of how Contracts Applications are used to get business done across the corporation.Do you think you have what it takes to help us accelerate the speed of business at Lockheed Martin? If you do, then we encourage you to apply today!Basic Qualifications:2 or more years of Java SE development2 years experience with Java Enterprise developmentExperience working with a relational database e.g. SQL Server, Oracle or MySQLDesired Skills:Experience with Agile developmentExperience using Jira or VersionOneExperience with EclipseExperience with GitExperience with CI/CDBASIC QUALIFICATIONS:job.QualificationsLockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. They’re dangerous. Critical. description: Electronic Arts Inc . is a leading global interactive entertainment software company. EA delivers games, content and online services for Internet-connected consoles, personal computers, mobile phones and tablets.We are looking for a Software Engineer to join the Frostbite team.Frostbite is a technology and collaboration platform for diverse game franchises, such as FIFA, Battlefield, Star Wars Battlefront, Mass Effect, Dragon Age, Need for Speed and Plant vs. Zombies Garden Warfare. Thousands of game developers all over the world are using Frostbite to create some of the best-looking games in the industry!You will be part of a talented multi-disciplinary team developing the tools and game runtime behind the amazing worlds you see in Frostbite games. This includes the workflows and systems for building levels and objects in Frostbite. In the team we collaborate closely on a day-to-day basis to make sure game teams around the world have great workflows and a performant and flexible runtime for their games.ResponsibilitiesInnovate and improve workflows, data builds and game systems for handling huge game worlds Design and implement systems and APIs used by thousands of game developers across EA Collaborate closely with game teams to ensure world class workflows and in-game performance Iterate on usability, tool performance and stability to power our users to create stunning gamesQualificationsBachelors’ or Masters’ Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Software Engineering from an accredited University. Strong C++ and software architecture skills Good collaboration and communication skills Eager to know more and thrives in a learning cultureBonus QualificationsExperience from game engine development and large-scale game development Experience with challenges such as scene and entity systems, handling huge worlds, streaming and subdivision or multi-user workflows Experience with data-oriented design and unit testing Experience with agile development practices

Job DescriptionOur Reston office is seeking talented programmers with strong computer science, math, and/or physics backgrounds for complex and challenging projects. As a Software Developer you will be responsible for implementing polished software incorporating probabilistic models of physical systems. Project teams are small, typically 2-5 people including Research Scientists and Software Developers. Each person is involved in the entire software development process, from initial concept through algorithm and software design to implementation, analysis, demonstration, and deployment. Our management structure gives you the freedom to create innovative designs and products. Metron takes affirmative action in support of its policy to employ and advance in employment individuals who are minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.VEVRAA Federal Contractor

Do you thrive in fast-paced technical environments and have a strong attention to detail? Are you eager to have a career where you are encouraged to meet your potential and have the opportunity to work for a prestigious company with an impressive global presence?FDM is currently seeking a number of ambitious and driven candidates with the aptitude for IT to work as FDM Consultants with our top clients, many of which are leading companies in the banking and financial services industry.FDM is a global IT and business services provider with a dedication to technical excellence and professional development and prestigious clients around the world. Our award-winning training program helps build the required skills needed to become a successful IT Specialist. As an FDM Consultant, you enter the industry at a high level, already trained to our clients’ specific systems and technologies.Prior to working with our clients, your training will take place at one of FDM’s US centers (metro DC area or New York City) or pop-up training locations (Austin, Charlotte, and more). Successful candidates will receive intense technical and professional training (10-16 weeks) through our award-winning Academy. You become an FDM employee from day one and are paid during the training period before placement onsite with our clients. Travel assistance for relocation may be available depending on location and circumstances.Software Developerswork with a range of responsibilities, including: writing, developing, testing, and reviewing code; supporting existing applications; liaising with end users to fix defects, find solutions, and test them; adding functionality to applications by designing and implementing solutions; and more. FDM has trained and placed developers in specialties including Java, C#, COBOL, .Net, and more.Fast-track career progression is a key focus of FDM, and our program will put you on a pathway that could lead into leadership roles working within multinational organizations.Suitable candidates are encouraged to apply immediately online.There is no better way to launch your career than with FDM!Essential Criteria: 4 year degree (preferably in Computer Science, IT, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar)A strong aptitude in IT and the interest and drive to expand your IT skill setExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsA problem solver with a keen eye for detailA desire to work at a large financial firm and ability to increase your financial knowledgeAble to engage yourself in a project and enjoy the challenges and processes involvedEager, ambitious, and adaptable to changeFlexible for national client placementsAble to commit to work for FDM for a minimum of two years working as an FDM Consultant following the training periodLegally authorized to work in the USFDM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. At the dawn of a new space age, Lockheed Martin is a pioneer, partner, innovator and builder. Our amazing men and women are on a mission to make a difference in the world and every single day we use our unique skills and experiences to craft, design and build solutions to some of the worlds’ hardest engineering problems. Do you want join a culture that inspires employees to think creatively, exceed their own expectations and build incredible products? We provide the resources, support and focus - if you have the passion and courage to dream big, then we want to build a better tomorrow with you.Do you have a passion to get humans back to the moon and eventually to Mars? NASA has developed a vision for exploration that includes the development of a Human Lander System and a Gateway Habitat in the next 5 years. The nation received a White House mandate to place humans back on the surface of the Moon by 2024. Lockheed Martin Space is onboard to be part of this historic event and is looking to build a core team of highly-motivated engineers excited to be working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. This is a rare opportunity for you to help NASA meet the challenges of the first step in achieving that “long-term presence at the Moon” and the stepping point for human missions to Mars.This position is contingent upon program win, anticipated December of 2019.To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin fosters an inclusive work environment that supports big picture thinking. Our employees play an active role in strengthening the quality of life where we live and work by volunteering more than 850,000 hours annually. description: OverviewJoin Notable and help us improve health care efficiency and effectiveness with our AI-powered tool for physicians. Notable's mission is to enrich every clinician-patient interaction by delivering a standardized, structured understanding of every encounter clinicians have with their patients. We use this structured understanding to drastically improve health care by automating hours of daily busy-work for clinicians, reduce the cost of health care by eliminating excess overhead, and improve patient outcomes by delivering data-driven insights to doctors and patients.We’re looking for a Forward-Deployed Engineer to work closely with Notable’s customers, sales representatives, customer success managers, and engineers to deliver solutions that exceed expectations. Job DescriptionCACI is seeking for talented IT/Engineer professionals that are excited to improve battlespace awareness and decision making support at all echelons across Combat Air Force (AF) Command and Control (C2) and Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR) enterprise, Intelligence Community (IC), Joint, and Coalition air, space, cyberspace, and intelligence components, systems, and architectures. You’ll support operations and maintenance (O&M) and research and development (R&D) for AF C2 & ISR related research, studies, analysis, operations, and you’ll increase mission effectiveness, improve information security, and implement new and emerging information access, processing, analysis and dissemination technologies in response to critical AF and IC multi-domain needs across Air, Space, and Cyber. This is your opportunity to work with a highly talented engineering team that builds technology that bridges software and intelligence community needs. Our client engagement processes, the way we collaborate, operate, and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. At CACI, you will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact by providing information solutions and services in support of national security missions and government transformation for Intelligence, Defense, and Federal Civilian customers. CACI is proud to provide dynamic careers for employees worldwide. CACI is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.

job_title: Become a Software Developer. No Experience Needed
description: Have you heard that “you need a college degree to get a job in the technology field?” Do you think you can’t land a high-paying job unless you already know someone who works there? Or have you been told that “technology jobs aren’t for people like you?”At Catalyte, we built a company on a belief that some of the best technology professionals come from unexpected places. We find the people that others overlook. And we provide a software development training program, at no cost to participants, to teach computer programming skills. Then, we hire successful graduates as entry-level software developers. You’ll work on client projects, surrounded by a supportive team of more experienced tech professionals who make sure you’re confident and ready to keep building your skills and a career.We’re currently looking for people to join our next training class, which will most likely begin in spring 2020. If you’re a curious and creative person who loves solving problems and being part of something bigger than yourself, we invite you to take our online screening to see if you might be a fit for us, too.What We Look ForHigh school diploma or GEDAt least 18 years oldU.S. citizen or eligible to work in the U.S. (Catalyte does not offer visa assistance or sponsorship)Free of illegal drug use for at least eighteen monthsNo prior felonyCompensationThere is no charge for the training. At successful completion of training, you will be given a 2-year apprenticeship paying in the $17-$18/hour range. Upon successful completion of the apprenticeship you will be adjusted to market rate typically between $65k-$80k.How to ApplyFirst, complete our two-hour online screening. It has math, logic, reading comprehension, and personality questions. Don’t worry about getting every question right; just focus on answering all the questions. Your responses help us figure out whether you could be a good fit to learn and succeed in software development. https://learn.catalyte.io/More About CatalyteCatalyte was founded 19 years ago on a belief that aptitude is equally distributed, but opportunity is not. We use artificial intelligence to identify individuals, of all backgrounds, who have the potential and ability to be great software developers. Through our training and employment program, we seek to create a ready-to-hire workforce that is diverse, skilled, and valuable. View coverage of Catalyte on 60 Minutes https://catalyte.io/catalyte-on-60-minutes/To learn more,Visit our website: https://catalyte.io/Job Types: Full-time, InternshipSalary: $65,000.00 to $80,000.00 /yearLocation:Baltimore, MD (Required)Language:English (Required)Work authorization:United States (Required)Visa Sponsorship Potentially Available:No: Not providing sponsorship for this jobThis Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneousAdaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in directionAchievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might failPeople-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projectsThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Outcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance culturePeople-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focusedTeam-oriented -- cooperative and collaborativeThis Job Is:A job for which military experienced candidates are encouraged to applyA good fit for applicants with gaps in their resume, or who have been out of the workforce for the past 6 months or moreA good job for someone just entering the workforce or returning to the workforce with limited experience and educationA job for which all ages, including older job seekers, are encouraged to applyOpen to applicants who do not have a college diploma

job_title: Big Data Senior Java Web Service Developer
description: Job DescriptionKey Position DetailsAre you ready to collaborate and innovate in an Agile environment with a motivated team on projects enabled by a robust cloud-based enterprise data platform? As a Senior Web Service Developer on the GEICO Big Data squad, you’ll thrive in a fast-paced innovative culture that turns data into information and uses that information to drive action. One focus is our Single View of the Customer (SVOC). You’ll create web services using cutting edge technology (Docker, Spring, GraphQL, etc) to integrate with other applications and allow GEICO to use data to provide tailored interactions for our customers.When you first join our SVOC team you will have the opportunity to go through our new Big Data Academy! This Academy will give you exposure to the cutting-edge technology that we use to develop SVOC, and prepare you with the skills needed to hit the ground running.Basic Qualifications:At least 4 years of programing experience in Java, Spring, and web servicesExperience in building Service Oriented Architecture applicationsStrong critical thinking, decision making, troubleshooting, multi-tasking and problem-solving skillsExcellent verbal/written communication skills, including communicating technical issues to non-technical audiencesA Bachelor's degree in a computer related field or equivalent professional experience is requiredPreferred Qualifications:Experience with GraphQL and DockerContinuous Integration (CI) using Gradle, Artifactory, Jenkins and Container based deploymentsTuning and monitoring using Dynatrace or Splunk MH1#Dice.#LI-MH1About GeicoFor more than 75 years, GEICO has stood out from the rest of the insurance industry! We are one of the nation's largest and fastest-growing auto insurers thanks to our low rates, outstanding service and clever marketing. We're an industry leader employing thousands of dedicated and hard-working associates. As a wholly owned subsidiary of Berkshire Hathaway, we offer associates training and career advancement in a financially stable and rewarding workplace.Our associates' quality of life is important to us. Full-time GEICO associates are offered a comprehensive Total Rewards Program*, including:401(k) and profit-sharing plansMedical, dental, vision and life insurancePaid vacation, holidays and leave programsTuition reimbursementAssociate assistance programFlexible spending accountsBusiness casual dressFitness and dining facilities (at most locations)Associate clubs and sports teamsVolunteer opportunitiesGEICO Federal Credit UnionBenefit offerings for positions other than full-time may vary.GEICO is an equal opportunity employer. GEICO conducts drug screens and background checks on applicants who accept employment offers.

SummaryPosted: Aug 14, 2019Role Number: 200091311Research in Natural Language and Machine Learning has already made a deep impact in Apple’s front-line products, such as Siri. Research Scientists at Siri are taking this a step further by redefining artificial intelligence, and building groundbreaking technology for natural language processing, machine learning, and large scale systems. This position involves a wide variety of skills and innovation, and is a rare opportunity that sits at the cutting-edge of machine learning and software engineering. Director of TechnologySounds True, a spiritually-based, multimedia publishing company, was founded with a mission to disseminate spiritual wisdom and help Wake Up the World. We are looking for a Technology Director to lead our overall IT strategic vision at our offices in Louisville, CO. This role will oversee our technology managed service partnership and execution of technology solutions which span complex business operations, data, security and information services. This role will work with various business units and support teams to leverage Sounds True content, user information and overall business performance analytics. This person will be a critical member of Sounds True’s leadership team, reporting to the CEO, and be responsible for scaling our business and stabilizing our technical infrastructure to help share our high quality content with the world.The Director of Technology drives all technology decisions with a goal of improving profitability and maintaining exceptional quality, demonstrates leadership around internal technical evaluations and prototype builds, owns technical problem solutions to solve core issues from repeating and assess risks, manages the technology budget and drives cost reduction initiatives. He/she partners with technology consultants to stay ahead of emerging technologies and keep us competitive, and oversees our managed service program with various consultants, integrators and contractors to drive high performance.Essential Responsibilities and Duties· Innovation: Create and execute the overall IT architecture for Sounds True which will guide the technical vision, lifecycle and roadmap to assist all aspects of our customers and internal operations. Includes supporting growth of new business lines and migrating Sounds True existing products to stable technology platforms, software and systems.· Leadership: Vital member of our leadership team, reporting to the CEO and responsible for leading the Technology divisions of Tech Ops and Application Engineering in scaling rapid growth with solid profitability.· Decision Leader: Commitment to effectively solve problems quickly with workarounds as needed, while determining the root cause to implement changes to stop the issue(s) from repeating in the future. Ability to think creatively, seek input and feedback from others when seeking possible solutions. Experienced using a decision-making matrix at a team, stakeholder and executive level.· Implementation (Application Engineering): Maintain, implement and improve existing e-commerce website, customer digital library, course/learning platform, ERP, data warehouse and other commercial-off-the-shelf (COTS) and internal custom systems.· Automation: Partner with the Operations Scalability VP to evaluate, recommend and implement business system solutions for short and long-term operational improvement and automation. Collaborate with business units to ensure integration and efficiency of technology solutions and security initiatives· Cost Analysis: Collaborate with various internal organizations to define and accomplish financial objectives, including forecasts, budgeting, and trending analysis. Drive and oversee ROI analysis, financial forecasting and costs related to IT support and services· Managed Services and Operational Performance Enforcement: Own the internal technical problem escalation process, including off hours problem resolution, to resolve technical issues within agreed time frames. This includes brainstorming solutions, troubleshooting and creating/implementing recommendations. Execute, monitor and enforce the IT governance, incident investigations, service level agreements (SLA’s), standards and policies across the organization. Oversee managed service partnership, performance metrics and costs; conduct annual audits and evaluation of services as compared to other consulting services in the area. Provide technical leadership around Tier 1 - III managed IT services.· Internal Software Management (Tech Ops IT): Develop requirements for workflow processes for internal software platform using best practices from continuous improvement methodologies. Researches, recommends and implements strategies and/or hardware/software enhancements to increase employee productivity by studying organization goals, strategies.· Risk Analysis and Recovery: Oversee information systems security including creating a policy and risk management framework including vulnerability management and threat analysis. Ensures corporate IT activities are well-planned and on track.· Data Analytics: Support Ops Scalability in rolling out a Data Warehouse across the company, including continuous improvement around automating financial, marketing and customer data metrics pulling and analysis.· Team Player: Collaborate with Operations, PMO (Product management), UX, Technical Project Management, Customer Service, Marketing and other business units to deliver a best-in-class customer experience. Servant people leader; lead, mentor, and develop a team of employees, contractors and partners to effectively deliver services for internal teams as well as end customers.Education and Formal Training· Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, Technology or related discipline preferred· Training in Agile Development, SCRUM, Lean Principles, Six Sigma, or other continuous improvement methodologies preferredQualifications and Skills· 6+ years of IT experience· 3+ years of IT Management/Directorship experience managing / leading teams composed of service desk, infrastructure support and application developers.· Strong track record of leadership, especially overseeing and developing people and teams with a “servant leadership” practice· Demonstrated success in collaborative style decision making, mentoring and coaching team members for professional growth· Ability to work under pressure, sometimes with competing deadlines· Experience with budgeting, ROI, forecasting, yearly reviews of staff, purchasing, project proposals, strategic planning and vendor managementTechnology and System Architecture· Expertise leading technology projects using best practice project management tools· Subject matter expertise in workflow automation and continuous improvement of systems and processes· Experience with website technologies and relational database preferred· Advanced knowledge of IT systems, network administration, network security, network protocols, database frameworks, and cybersecurity methods for an eCommerce company preferred· Analytical mindset; ability to evaluate technology solutions using values-based rigor· Awareness of legal and regulatory compliance for IT systems· Understanding of Windows 10, Microsoft Office 365, Google Suite, Windows Server 2012, TCP/IP, application and software development, business analysis, management, basic network troubleshooting, hardware troubleshootingSounds True is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We offer an excellent working environment and great benefits. To learn more about us, visit SoundsTrue.com. description: Dell Boomi - Senior Principal Software Engineer - Java Developer - APIM Boomi OverviewAre you ready to work on world changing technologies? Today, organizations need to move with increased agility and insight to grow and thrive. Magazine as one of the best workplaces. By tapping the power of the Boomi platform, any organization can significantly shorten project times, reduce costs, streamline processes and boost productivity. Our technologies connect applications, assure data quality and automate workflows.Working at Dell Boomi means doing what you love. We hire trailblazers with an entrepreneurial spirit who can solve challenging problems, make a real impact in technology and want to build something big. Willingness to explore and learn new technologies that are unfamiliarOpen to sharing new ideas / improvementsTakes pride in own workBenefitsWe offer highly competitive salaries, bonus programs, world-class benefits, and unparalleled growth and development opportunities — all to create a compelling and rewarding work environment.Company Description – Dell TechnologiesWith more than 100,000 team members globally, we promote an environment that is rooted in the entrepreneurial spirit in which the company was founded. Opportunity SnapshotDigital Realty is looking for an entrepreneurial, outcome-driven colleague to help support our sales team in developing and closing sales by providing public/private/hybrid cloud expertise as well as deep networking and infrastructure design acumen. He/She should also have a strong background in cloud services environments, with the ability to guide architectural solutions for private/public/hybrid and complex network deployments with a keen ability to translate customer requirements and business outcomes into Digital Realty technical solutions. Additionally, the Solutions Architect will be a critical part of our global ecosystem development team to foster rich interconnection and service exchange within Digital Realty’s global connected campuses.The RoleThe primary role of the Sr. Solutions Architect will be to act as a technical advisor for Digital Realty’ customers and the Digital Realty’ sales teams to architect creative and complex IT/cloud/networking and service delivery solutions for our customers and partners. The role requires a broad range of knowledge and experience at the application layer to optimize performance over flexible and high performing infrastructure and tailored data center services. Build evidence and models to demonstrate expected (desired) resultsAble to facilitate workshop style sessions with customers to extract important areas of customers current architecture. Can keenly couple key insights to present highly technical concepts and solutions specifics to audiences of varying technical capabilities in a clear, concise and easily understood mannerCoach and provide technical leadership to others on network designs, platform sizing, infrastructure system design and the application of new technologies and project management methodologiesProfessional sales consultation of customer technical requirements to develop viable solutions, resulting in bookingsThis position supports all of Digital Realty North American platform (US & CAN) and therefore may require approximately 30% travel. The Solutions Architect may also be required to travel to other markets or other locations where customer IT / engineering groups are located to conduct and lead on-site meetings that are presented to customers.REQUIRED EXPERIENCE:5+ years of technical experience – Hosting/Cloud companies, Cloud/Networking/IT consulting. Now, Digital Realty is building a unique ecosystem of open solutions that power customer growth through exceptional service on a foundation of unrivaled data center expertise. The new Digital Realty combines unparalleled data center services, carrier-dense interconnection, real estate acumen, and financial strength to create unique power of choice and value when and where our customers need it.Our MissionTo provide our customers with the trusted foundation for the digital worldOur VisionTo build a network of connected campuses and internet gateways that become the heart of the internet and cloud, powering growth and prosperity for customers, employees and shareholders.Our ValuesGuide our decisions and actions every day—above all else, we value customers, excellence, talent, teamwork and success.About Digital RealtyDigital Realty Trust, Inc. supports the data center and colocation strategies of more than 2,000 firms across its secure, network-rich portfolio of data centers located throughout North America, Europe, Asia and Australia. Software EngineerIf you are interested in being part of a small team of full-stack engineers building out an event driven system supporting one of the country’s largest industrial distributors, please check us out. Our preferred tech stack is .NET (latest) with open source mixed in whenever possible. Our philosophy is right tool for the right job. Our front end applications range from embedded .Net Forms on scanners and kiosks to server based Angular WebAPI applications. We are currently building out a service bus on top of MassTransit and our persistence stores are primarily SQL Server with a mix of ORM frameworks on top. We are ideally looking for a mid-senior level developer with a broad exposure to .NET framework. Grow as a developer by building things that help local businesses around the world thriveGroupon’s mission is to become the daily habit in local commerce and fulfill our purpose of building strong communities through thriving small businesses by connecting people to a vibrant, global marketplace for local services, experiences and goods. In the process, we’re positively impacting the lives of millions of customers and merchants globally. Even with thousands of employees spread across multiple continents, we still maintain a culture that inspires innovation, rewards risk-taking and celebrates success. If you want to take more ownership of your career, then you're ready to be part of Groupon.Are you a passionate, energetic and technology enthusiast eager to work at a rapid pace with the flexibility to work across our suite of technologies? Are you are a problem solver; someone who enjoys debugging code, resolving issues, and creating solutions for common problems? Do you get a little obsessed with the details?We are looking for a software engineer to join our Anti-Fraud Engineering team to support and evolve the design and implementation of our systems to detect and prevent consumer fraud.We’re a “best of both worlds” kind of company. We’re big enough to have the resources and scale, but small enough that a single person has a surprising amount of autonomy and can make a meaningful impact. We’re curious, fun, a little intense, and kind of obsessed with helping local businesses thrive. Does that sound like a compelling place to work?The Anti-Fraud Engineering team will:Design and build systems that add fraud detection and prevention capabilities to order processing and payment services.Build tools for operations staff which bring them insights into active fraud trends and the capabilities to fight them.Partner with industry-leading fraud and payments system providers by architecting and implementing robust and failure-resistant technical integrationsBe curious, fun, a little intense, and kind of obsessed with helping local businesses thrive. Does that sound like a compelling place to work?You’ll spend time on the following:Building large-scale e-commerce platform technologies using open-source technologiesUsing machine learning techniques to design data models to predict and detect fraudulent behavior.Implementing high-performance RESTful web services serving billions of requests a weekDigging in to consumer behavioral data to identify fraud trendsWorking directly with operations staff to build tools that help them be more effective and efficient at preventing fraud.Unraveling the myriad of fraud prevention technologies available globallyWe’re excited about you if you have:Bachelor’s degreeAt least 2 years of industry experienceUnderstanding of REST, microservices for distributed architecture, support and planning utilizing Ruby, Python, Java, Scala, Go, or similar technologies.Clear understanding of testing methodologiesExperience with any of MySQL, Postgres, Redshift, Snowflake, DynamoDB, or RedisBig plus if you have experience with e-commerce payments or fraudWe value engineers who are:Customer-focused: We believe that doing what’s right for the customer is ultimately what will drive our business forward.Obsessed with Quality: Your Production code Just Works & scales linearlyTeam players. You believe that more can be achieved together. You listen to feedback and also provide supportive feedback to help others grow/improve.Fast learners: We are willing to disrupt our existing business to trial new products and solutions. You love learning how to use new technologies and then rapidly apply them to new problems.Pragmatic: We do things quickly to learn what our customers desire. You know when it’s appropriate to take shortcuts that don’t sacrifice quality or maintainability.Owners: Engineers at Groupon know how to positively impact the business.Groupon's purpose is to build strong communities through thriving small businesses. To learn more about the world's largest local ecommerce marketplace, click here for the latest Groupon news. Plus, be sure to check out the values that shape our culture, guide our strategy and make our company a great place to work. And just don't take our word for it. Hear from real Groupon team members and learn more about our inclusive employee groups. If all of this sounds like something that's a great fit for you, then click apply and let's see where this takes us.Groupon is an Equal Opportunity EmployerQualifications for employment, promotion, and other terms and conditions of employment are based upon the ability to perform the job. Equal-employment opportunities are provided to all applicants and employees without regard to race, creed, religion, color, age, national origin, sex, disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, ancestry, marital status, military discharge status (excluding dishonorable discharge), veteran status, citizenship status, or other legally protected status. We are all responsible for maintaining this policy. Groupon is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may email us at hraccommodations at groupon.com. If you have concerns related to Groupon’s equal employment opportunities, you may contact Groupon's Ethics Reporting Service Ethicspoint.

description: POSITION SUMMARY / OBJECTIVEThis position will leverage data management and risk management skills to assist IFG Companies in the evaluation and management of property and liability exposures. The position will be responsible for developing building, validating, and maintaining catastrophe exposure data; evaluating the catastrophe risk profile of individual property accounts; assisting in the evaluation and development of portfolio catastrophe risk management reports and assisting when needed on other risk management activities. The position will work closely and will provide support to underwriters within IFG Companies’ Property and Liability units.POSITION RESPONSIBILITIESValidating the quality and integrity of property exposure data and performing pre-processing modeling activities; including data consistency checks. Identify and automate workflows so as to build a unified consistent data collection mart.Working with IFG Companies’ technology group to ensure data uniformity within the catastrophe risk modeling and rate making processes.Supporting requests from underwriters to assess, evaluate and price catastrophe risk through the use of catastrophe risk model results.Supporting the Actuarial unit in providing catastrophe risk reporting and effectively managing reinsurance programs.Performing and Analyzing account and portfolio level catastrophe risk model runs.Planning and organizing information with problem solving, decision making skills. Use of statistical models using R and Python is a plus.Effectively communicate catastrophe exposure and risk analysis with the ERM and Underwriting teams.Assist the ERM unit in performing operational risk review on people, processes, controls and systems.Assist in the implementation and monitoring of IFG Companies’ risk limits.Perform other duties as required.KNOWLEDGE / SKILLS / ABILITIESAbility to demonstrate planning and organizational skills.Strong computer skills (Excel|Word|SQL) with demonstrated high accuracy output.Experience with Python or R is a plus.Excellent interpersonal and written/oral communication skills.Excellent attention to detail.EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE / CERTIFICATIONS4 year degree in statistics, mathematics, actuarial science, economics, risk management or finance from an accredited college or university.2-3 years’ pf experience in Data Analytics or Risk Analysis is required.Background in Insurance is a plus.PHYSICAL DEMANDSOccasional travel, up to 20%, is required.BENEFITSWe offer a competitive compensation and benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401(k), flexible spending, short-term and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, long-term care, education assistance and paid time off, including paid parental leave and a birthday holiday.IFG Companies is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce. PLC Controls EngineerWith a passion for leveraging best of class automation, our Torani Controls Engineer ensures all shop floor technology in our Flavor Factory is fine-tuned and functioning optimally. You excite and energize the organization demonstrating how shop floor equipment and controls, when properly integrated with enterprise business systems, help reduce frustration, eliminate errors and drive out waste.As the subject matter expert you’re responsible for maintaining, documenting, and troubleshooting all PLC controls and SCADA systems in the plant. You’ve a reputation and are recognized for impeccable internal customer service while working in partnership and collaborating frequently with the rest of the Flavor Operations and key support teams (Maintenance, Manufacturing, Quality, Supply Chain and IT).SUCCESS FACTORS (first 12-18 months)· Flavor Operations Performance Support. As a trusted Engineering partner within Flavor Operations, you provide ongoing support that keeps automated shop floor process and packaging systems operating optimally. You utilize proven trouble shooting skills to evaluate and address line upset conditions created by PLC and HMI server system control issues. You monitor equipment and systems performance, respond quickly across the facility to minimize downtime and ensure continuous production. When failures occur, you perform root cause analysis and ensure long term corrective action is taken to prevent recurrence.· Controls and Automation Subject Matter Expert. Tapping into your extensive knowledge and working diligently with vendors and contractors, you ensure accurate and complete documentation is accessible for existing and new installations for electrical systems, motor controls, PLC programs and HMIs. You continually update training materials for maintenance technicians and operators. You are a key resource to ensure that all planned and completed electrical work conforms to local building codes and industry standards.· Asset Maintenance and Sustainability. You develop and deploy effective preventative and predictive maintenance processes and procedures that optimize performance and prolong asset life. You work with key stakeholders in Flavor Operations to ensure appropriate time and attention goes into organizing, inspecting, and cleaning practices.· Integration Guru. You are able to understand and interpret key Flavor Operations business requirements while working with the team to plan, design, and deploy middle ware that links the production shop floor to the enterprise systems (Oracle). You assist in planning, designing and managing projects that achieve technical and operational objectives. You have proven a solid understanding of Allen Bradley RX Logix series PLCs, Allen Bradley HMIs, Factory Talk Services Platform, Servo-motors, VFD's (AB, Danfoss, etc.).· Continuous Process Improvement. You collaborate with cross-functional departments including QA, R&D, Marketing, IT and Finance to ensure planned improvements are aligned with the Torani organization goals and objectives. You are committed to continuously improving plant software and hardware to minimize downtime on equipment.· Have Fun!Minimuim Qualifications· BS degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering, or equivalent combination of education and experience in the field.· One to four years hands on experience designing, programming, installing, de-bugging and maintaining PLC based control systems.· Experience with Allen Bradley Control Logix PLCs and Rockwell MES preferred.· Good written and oral communications skills.· Ability to set priorities and to be self-disciplined and consistent.· Fluent in AB PLC programming as well as Rockwell Factory Talk tools.· Ability to develop and implement action steps and follow-through with the people responsible for them.· Computer literacy in MS Office, programming software for Allen Bradley, Rockwell Factory Talk.· Ability to develop and implement process improvement solutions.· Lives in SF Bay area, or willing to relocate at your own expense· Eligible to work in the US without sponsorship (now & in the future)· Ability to lift 50 pounds· Fluent in written and verbal EnglishJob Type: Full-timeExperience:relevant: 1 year (Preferred)maintaining PLC based control systems?: 4 years (Required)developing & implementing process improvement solutions?: 2 years (Required)designing, programming, installing and de-bugging: 4 Selects methods, techniques and evaluation criteria to obtain results. Involved in the assessment and construction of Business Requirements Documents and Design Documents.Cyber Risk COE helps University of California locations and organizations in their management of information and technology risks by delivering end-to-end solutions, using proven methodologies and tools in a consistent manner. Software engineers at PayPal develop innovative solutions and high-quality products that touch millions of people every day around the globe. Our engineers solve some of the most complex technical problems in the world of connected payments across all business units, including PayPal, Braintree, Venmo, Paydiant and others. We are looking for the highest levels of technical talent and programming skills, as well as a keen desire to deeply understand our products and services to push our technology forward with respect to functionality, performance, reliability, and scalability.You’ll work alongside the best and the brightest engineering talent in the industry. We have opportunities in a wide range of areas including development, design, search, platform, test, quality, big data, front end and back end. As a core participant of your team, you’ll estimate engineering efforts, prioritize projects, plan implementations, and triage production issues. You need to be dynamic, collaborative, and curious as we build new experiences, improve existing products, and develop distributed systems powering the world’s largest e-commerce and payments websites at a scale only a few companies can match.Key Responsibilities:Code high-volume softwareCreate web applications using React/Node and other technologiesBuild and develop new user facing experiencesPartner closely with cross functional teams in design, product and other business units Basic Requirements:Graduated, or will be graduating, with a bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science or related field from an accredited college or universityStrong applied experience. You’ve built, broken, and rebuilt software applications. We’re looking for creative thinkers who also know how to create real-world products.Solid experience working with or familiarity around Java, C++ and/or PythonVery strong foundational knowledge in Object-Oriented Design Principles, Data Structures, Algorithms, SQL/NoSQL, Operating Systems, and Software EngineeringWorking knowledge of web technologies (such as HTTP, HTML/DOM, JavaScript, CSS, AJAX) will be beneficialFamiliar with Node.js applicationsUnderstanding around concepts like Web Services, SOA, REST APIsA constant desire to grow, learn, and explore new thingsPosition Location: VariesJob_Description_Summary: At PayPal, we’re literally reinventing how the world pays and gets paid. We understand that it’s about people. We connect individuals to let them shop, get paid, donate and send money using today’s technology with the confidence that comes from the security and control PayPal enables. Are you ready to help us change the world? The world’s leading payments company, PayPal, brings together a family of brands that are revolutionizing the way people move money. At PayPal you will be immersed in an amazing community with a vibrant culture that thrives on innovation, collaboration, inclusion and wellness.Who we are: Fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 286 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.We're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom.PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

***THIS PROJECT IS EXPECTED TO LAST THREE MONTHS***Position SummaryThe Lead Embedded Systems Engineer transitions prototype electronics and mechanical modules to a new system FW architecture for mass production and develops innovative leading technology to be used in the specialty coffee industry. This position is a SW/FW technical leader among a team of EE, SW and mobile app engineers. Job DescriptionMetron’s Operations Analysis and Simulation Sciences (OASiS) division is seeking a talented and enthusiastic software engineer with leadership experience to design, develop, integrate, manage, test, and deploy software related to unmanned underwater vehicles (UUVs) and mission planning systems. This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer looking to advance their career to work with a team of developers, test engineers, and marine technicians, and to interact directly with senior Government project and program managers.Metron is a scientific consulting company dedicated to solving challenging problems in national defense through the development and application of advanced mathematical methods. At Metron, we value innovative research experience, inquisitiveness, and insight. Here at the OASiS division, we employ mathematical models, statistical analyses, simulations, analytical reasoning, and knowledge of the operational environment with the ultimate goal of understanding and improving real-world processes and operations. The OASiS Division works closely with the Department of Defense (DoD), Department of Homeland Security (DHS), Department of the Navy (DoN), Office of Naval Research (ONR), Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA), Naval Information Warfare Center (NIWC), Commander, Pacific Fleet (COMPACFLT), Naval Undersea Warfare Center (NUWC), and many other government agencies in pursuit of our mission.Desired QualificationsBS or MS in Computer science, Engineering, or related field3+ years of relevant development experience required, experience leading development activities preferredAbility to work in a team environment composed of software developers, hardware engineers, analysts, marine technicians, and Government decision makersProven track record of managing complex software development effortsAble to interpret requirements, develop architectural approaches and designs, build and monitor project execution schedulesJava knowledge required, C++ knowledge a plusLinux background and networking experience highly preferred;Experience integrating hardware with software is a plusExperience with circuit design and testing is a plusExcellent communication skills, both written and oral, required.Ability to interface directly with Metron and Government leadership, required.Some travel required (less than 10%)Current DoD Secret security clearance requiredPosition Location: San Diego, CAAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or protected veteran status. Metron takes affirmative action in support of its policy to employ and advance in employment individuals who are minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.VEVRAA Federal Contractor

job_title: Head of Data Analytics and Systems Architecture
description: Title: Head of Data Analytics and Systems Architecture Reports To: COO Location: Seattle, WA General Description: Strideline is a fast growing apparel company based in Seattle, WA seeking a Head of Data Analytics and Systems Architecture as we scale at a sustained 20% growth rate YoY.This role serves as a key member of the Strideline Team and is responsible for satisfying the needs of stakeholders in the chain of business processes which connect Strideline’s global supply partners, the Company, and its customers. To be effective in the role, the Head of Data Analytics and Systems Architecture must develop a clear understanding of the company's objectives and foster a spirit of partnership between the supply chain organization, finance/accounting, key functional leaders, customer service, sales, and distribution operations.Growth will be fueled by an aggressive push into new markets, a robust product roadmap, and brand/line extensions. With growth, Strideline will continue to evolve its business model, placing greater emphasis on differentiation via superior performance of its internal operations and supply chain. This emphasis on differentiation is to be enabled via improved nimbleness, data accuracy, and adaptability when servicing the needs of the customer and supported by robust cross-functional capabilities. The Head of Data Analytics and Systems Architecture will be responsible for defining, developing and implementing changes necessary to achieve optimal performance through consistent data and forward looking automation. As such, the successful candidate will exert influence over the company's evolving business model and lead efforts to develop capabilities, which are necessary to differentiate the company among its competitors and as part of the overall brand mission and experience.Key Responsibilities: Identify and implement corrective actions regarding process inefficiencies.Completely own all data (and its accuracy) from all data sources and work with appropriate teams to address limitations/issues.Build from scratch reporting/forecasting tools to forecast production needs from company database.Ensure assigned production application systems are up and running to support the business.Proactively monitor assigned systems to ensure early detection of potential issues, adequate resource capacity where applicable, and successful data backup that can be restored as needed.Triage and resolve incidents related to application systems, and EDI transmissions with varying degrees of complexity.Apply understanding of system features to help our business teams exploit current system functionality, increasing our return on investment through maximization of feature utilization and automation of processes.Design, develop, and support systems and data integration as required by the business. Respond to business needs for data exchange with third parties.Maintain documentation of development, test, and production environments for assigned systems as applicable.Manage assigned vendor relationships to ensure service and technology delivery in accordance with the terms of our contracts.Work with business leaders to identify opportunities to optimize business processes through system integration, minimizing duplicate data entry and improving data integrity.Research and share value of emerging technologies and trends applicable to Strideline’s business challenges. Keep pace with and share advancements in packaged software solutions with the potential to deliver value and efficiency.Follow best practices for managing the implementation of changes, patches, and upgrades into the production environment.Provide clear and concise plans for upgrades/changes to systems and infrastructure.Monitor order placement and data processing to ensure 100% of orders ship on time.Your background should include and or exhibit: Minimum 7 years’ experience in a CPG (consumer packaged goods) business with domestic and international footprint.Experience aligning solutions to architecture strategy.Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Business Management or related field preferred; equivalent experience accepted.Minimum of five (5) years of experience supporting complex technologies and systems, ideally at a CPG company.Understanding of relational database concepts (e.g., logical schemas, physical table structures, data attributes)Strong skills in data analytics and ability to mine SQL for business reporting.Ability to exercise independent judgment in planning, organizing, and performing systems analyst tasks. Some independent judgment required in setting priorities of tasks among multiple assigned projects.Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively with individuals and groups at all levels of the organization.Great communicator who can express ideas clearly and concisely in written form and in casual and formal presentations, adapting style and vocabulary as required to suit the audience. Effective listening skills.Excellent time management and organizational skills and ability to balance multiple prioritiesCreative, high energy, results-driven team player with a positive attitude.Self-motivated and tenacious; trustworthy and professional.Willingness and flexibility to adapt to changing business needs and deadlines.Additional Responsibilities may include but not be limited to: Travel (< 20%) domestic and international via commercial carrier.Job Type: Full-timeExperience:relevant: 5 years (Preferred)Work Location:One locationBenefits:Health insuranceDental insuranceVision insurance

R1 RCM Inc. is a leading provider of technology-enabled revenue cycle management services which transform and solve challenges across health systems, hospitals and physician practices. Headquartered in Chicago, R1® is a publicly-traded organization with employees throughout the US and international locations.Our mission is to be the one trusted partner to manage revenue, so providers and patients can focus on what matters most. Our priority is to always do what is best for our clients, patients and each other. With our proven and scalable operating model, we complement a healthcare organization’s infrastructure, quickly driving sustainable improvements to net patient revenue and cash flows while reducing operating costs and enhancing the patient experience.The Senior Systems Engineer will be part of a team of individuals responsible for design and maintaining enterprise technology infrastructure stacks hosted in on-premise and cloud solutions. This is an enterprise role supporting mission critical production product environments and corporate services solutions. A successful Senior Systems Engineer must be able to analyze requirements and recommend innovative solutions, maintain production systems, work with others to resolve technical problems, and contribute to the development of new systems or major system enhancements.Responsibilities:Includes, but not limited to, planning, systems analysis, design, scripting, database administration, and documentation.Analyzing existing systems to recommend changes/improvements to them to maximize user capabilities.Meeting assigned project deadlines and work schedules. Timely and accurate completion of special projects and assignments.Effective use of time and equipment to accomplish assigned projects.Understanding, supporting, enforcing and complying with company policies, procedures and standards of business ethics and conduct.Effective and consistent cooperation and communication with Team Leadership and key company personnel.Performing duties in a professional, polite, considerate and courteous manner.Other duties as assigned.Required Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Information Systems or equivalent work experience.Significant experience with designing, deploying, and maintaining secure and scalable infrastructure and operational plans for medium to large size companies.Systems engineering and datacenter operations background, including experience supporting custom applications, as well as ongoing development activities for same.Deep knowledge of implementing and maintaining infrastructure, for application development environments. (Ex. IIS, continuous integration tools, and understanding of SDLC processes.)Deep knowledge of VMware environments, including configuration and administration of medium to large environments. (VCP preferred, but not required.)Deep knowledge of load balancer technologies (preferably F5 or NSX) including design, configuration, and administration.Deep knowledge of SAN environments, including configuration and administration of medium to large environments.Experience developing solutions for high-availability and disaster recovery.Experience with various backup technologies.Scripting experience (PowerShell, YAML, TQL , etc...)Strong organizational skills, including effective use of time and equipment to accomplish assigned projects and managing multiple concurrent tasks.Strong written and verbal communications skills, with ability to interrelate and communicate with people within the workplace.Strong problem-solving abilities, with keen attention to detail.Able to read and understand technical manuals and procedural documentation.Ability to conduct research into issues as required.Ability to advise, mentor, and teach others.Self-motivated and directed, with the ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.Desired Qualifications:On-call availability.Moderate travel, not exceeding 20% of time.Sitting for extended periods of timeDexterity to operate a computer keyboard, mouse, and to handle other computer componentsWorking in an evolving healthcare setting, we use our shared expertise to deliver innovative solutions. Our fast-growing team has opportunities to learn and grow through rewarding interactions, collaboration and the freedom to explore professional interests.Our associates are given valuable opportunities to contribute, to innovate and create meaningful work that makes an impact in the communities we serve around the world. We also offer a culture of excellence that drives customer success and improves patient care. We believe in giving back to the community and offer a competitive benefits package. To learn more, visit: R1RCM.com.

Invitae is a healthcare technology company that leverages genetic information to empower doctors and patients to make informed medical decisions. Our software engineers work on a variety of projects ranging from innovations in healthcare systems to taming the chaos of biology. We're constantly improving our tools and technologies to deliver the highest quality actionable information for patient health. If you want to apply your knowledge and skills to improve the lives of millions of people join our team.About our team:Invitae needs experienced engineers with diverse backgrounds to help us achieve our mission - provide genetic information to billions of people. We are a cross-functional team of scientific domain experts and dedicated, curious engineers. We build systems that take massive amounts of genomic data, combine it with the world's scientific literature, add to it years of rigorously curated results, and package it all neatly for our scientists to consume. It's a lot of information. As the data gets bigger, our systems need to get better and faster. That's where you come in.What you will do:Help define and build new features or applications based on technology and business needs.Write structured, tested, readable and maintainable code.Participate in code reviews to ensure code quality and distribute knowledge.Lead technical efforts for internal or external customer needs.Support your teammates by continuing to learn and grow.What you bring:Industry experience with full stack architecture and distributed systems.Minimum 3 years experience with Bachelors in EngineeringMultiple years of industry experience with backend or frontend frameworks such as:Python/DjangoJavaScript/ReactScala/PlayOther common industry standardsHands on experience with databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, NoSQL, etc.). Tuning and query optimization a plus.Top notch communication skills. Experience with distributed teams is a plus.A mission-oriented mindset and a desire to never stop learning.At Invitae, we value diversity and provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
