but not limited to, pay for performance bonus, a profit share plan, comprehensive health benefits and a 401k with match.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $70,000.00 /yearExperience:Asp.Net: 3 years (Preferred)SQL: 3 years (Preferred)C#: 3 years (Preferred)Education:Bachelor's (Preferred)Additional Compensation:Bonuses

job_title: Software Engineer, Test Tools & Infrastructure , Loop Commerce
description: Job Description:About Loop CommerceReady to work on an exciting product that is at the forefront of changing an entire e-commerce industry and touches millions of consumers across leading retailers? Loop Commerce, a Synchrony Solution, has transformed the retail experience with GiftNow® by allowing retailers to offer gift givers enhanced choices at check out and gives gift recipients personalized options. We’ve recently expanded our capabilities with our Gift360™ suite of products, to drive further value to retailers and consumers. As we continue to grow, we need talented, passionate and innovative people to join our team and help redefine how people buy and receive gifts across the digital and physical worlds.We offer a vibrant culture as being a family-like and fun-loving atmosphere, agile, and focused on defining the leading edge of something meaningful for millions of people. We’re located in the heart of Silicon Valley in Mountain View, CA within a two-minute walk from the Caltrain station. And now, while maintaining our start-up culture and fast-pace innovation, Loop has the backing and support of Synchrony to fuel and accelerate its growth and success.Essential Responsibilities:Designing and developing robust, intuitive, elegant, and useful automatic testing tools.Designing smart, comprehensive and complex testing scenarios for revealing critical bugs.Designing and implementing automatic load test scenarios.Collaborate with Product, UX, and Engineering through requirements, design and implementation stages.Perform other duties and/or special projects as assignedQualifications/Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Related technical fieldA minimum of 5 years of experience in Java/Python/Groovy/Ruby development and QA methodologiesA minimum of 3 years’ experience with UI testing and Selenium.A minimum of 3 years’ experience in test automation and test tools development, & Web technologies such as HTTP, HTML, REST, JSON, AJAX etc.A minimum of 1 year experience in SQLDesired Characteristics:Master’s degreeStart-up experience,Strong analytical skills – ability to understand the constraints of a design problem and identify the tradeoffs.Passion for opportunities Loop has to offer its customers, retailers & partnersOutstanding communications, relationship building, and collaboration skills.Proven ability to partner and communicate effectively with all levels of the organizationEligibility Requirements:You must be 18 years or olderYou must have a high school diploma or equivalentYou must be willing to take a drug test, submit to a background investigation and submit fingerprints as part of the selection processYou must be able to satisfy the requirements of Section 19 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.Effective 1-1-18, new hires (Level 4-7) must have 9 months of continuous service with the company before they are eligible to post on other roles. Once this new hire time in position requirement is met, the associate will have a minimum 6 months’ time in position before they can post for future non-exempt roles. Employees, level 8 or greater, must have at least 24 months’ time in position before they can post. All internal employees must have at least a “consistently meets expectations” performance rating and have approval from your manager to post (or the approval of your manager and HR if you don’t meet the time in position or performance requirement).All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.Reasonable Accommodation Notice:Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.If you need special accommodations, please call our Career Support Line so that we can discuss your specific situation. We can be reached at 1-866-301-5627. Representatives are available from 8am – 5pm Monday to Friday, Central Standard Time.Grade/Level: 11Job Family Group:Information Technology

SUMMARY: Helps to maintain and support the ongoing development and use of business systems within the company.DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Work with users to analyze and understand their business needsAuthor business and technical documents based on those needsImplement and document software solutions meet the needs of business usersPerform ad hoc reporting and data analysis for management staffLead small project teams through infrastructure upgrade and software development projectsProvide high-level IT training to end usersSUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES: This job has no supervisory responsibilities.QUALIFICATIONS:Bachelor’s degree in Computer or Information Science or equivalent work experienceMinimum of 5 years’ full-time work experience in Information Technology fieldMust have 3+ years’ experience performing business requirements analysisPossess strong data analysis skillsMust be highly proficient writing SQL queriesMust have direct experience or skills needed to lead/manage IT projectsBe able to write software code and transfer existing skills to other programming languages as neededSoftware development experience with .NET and/or ColdFusion is a plusFluency in MS Office productivity applications requiredERP application knowledge a plus
